meanings.definition: To beg or borrow without intending to repay.
meanings.sent1: She would often mouch money from her friends and never give it back.
meanings.sent2: He likes to mouch snacks from the pantry when no one is looking.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mouch some extra treats by looking extra cute.
meanings.sent4: His brother always manages to mouch his way out of doing chores.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel would mouch nuts from the bird feeder every morning.

meanings.sent1: The kids would mouch around the park after school.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mouch in the mall for hours without buying anything.
meanings.sent3: The dog loves to mouch in the backyard, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seem to mouch across the sky on a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The old man would mouch along the beach, lost in his thoughts.

meanings.definition: A person who begs or borrows without intending to repay.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the neighborhood mouch, always asking for favors.
meanings.sent2: The office mouch would constantly borrow pens and never return them.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic had a designated mouch who ate everyone's snacks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a mouch when she forgot her wallet and had to ask for money.
meanings.sent5: The school had a reputation for having a mouch in every class.
